Chameleon scales became gray and he started shake "It's not fair!!!!" said =
the male "Why have I to stand things like this??? isn't it enought that I h=
ave to stand every taunt of most bots of this base?"

Bullet stood over Cha=
meleon watching every move he made. "Fair is what I sat it is right now." H=
e says quickly losing his temper. The former trainer got a little closer pl=
acing a hand on Chameleons shoulder ans started to squeeze "I'll tell you w=
hat, you do as I "ask" and I'll see to it you're never picked on again, If =
you don't do as I say the only picking going on will be the scavengers clea=
ning out your carcass."

"Well" said the male while he turned the chair and=
 looked to Bullet "I just have a thing to do..."

Blaze stepped forward loo=
king down at the screen that had denied the password, "I think he's serious=
 about hurting you." she says in a "good cop" tone. She knew Bullets temper=
 well enough not to question his intentions. "I hope that whatever you plan=
 to do gets us some answers.".

    Bullet=
 tightened his grip, not happy about what he'd just heard. "Well I
    sugg=
est you find a way real quick or you'll end up in so many pieces that
    i=
t'll take a Millenium to reassemble you." The bully pushed Chameleon toward=

    a nearby console, "You know what to do, or do I have to make myself mo=
re
    clear?"

    Blaze didn't want to get involved, she knew that Bullet=
 wasn't fond of her
    and wasn't going to become his next target. Subcons=
ciously she wanted to
    know what was going on too. She remembered an exp=
losion that knocked her
    offline but her memory circuits were staticy be=
fore that. Somehow she knew
    that her and Bullet had to stick together.
